abstractText: This Nepalese palm-leaf manuscript from the 15th century contains a tantric initiation manual called Abhiṣekavidhi, which describes the rituals to be performed at various stages of the consecration procedure (carefully marked with a final rubric for each subsection). This manual is apparently an excerpt from the Vajrāvalī of Abhayākaragupta, a long and complex work on tantric rituals.
